Detailed Description

An item which implements functions to get the module of this item.

An item which implements functions to get the module of this item. The constructor gets the required arguments to operate

Author(s):
Joachim Ansorg <jansorg@gmx.de>

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CGroupManagerItem::CGroupManagerItem ( CGroupManager * parent,
const QString & caption,
const QString & modulename,
CModuleInfo * module_info,
CKey * bookmarkKey = 0,
CGroupManagerItem::itemType Type = CGroupManagerItem::Module )

The constructor.

This constructor takes a CGroupManager as parent, the created item will be on the top of the tree.

Parameters:
parent   The CGRoupManager which will contain the new item
caption   The caption of the item. This parameter will eb passes to
See also:
init()
Parameters:
modulename   The name of our module. This is used in addition to the CModuleInfo object because sometimes the moduleinfo is missing and we don't want to loose bookmarks.
module_info   The CModuleInfo object we use for the item. May be zero because a group doesn't have a CModuleInfo.
Type   The type of the created item. May ba Module, Bookmark or Group. If you leave out the parameter it will be Module by default.

CGroupManagerItem::CGroupManagerItem ( CGroupManagerItem * parent,
const QString & caption,
const QString & modulename,
CModuleInfo * module_info,
CKey * bookmarkKey = 0,
CGroupManagerItem::itemType Type = CGroupManagerItem::Module )

The constructor.

This constructor takes a CGroupManagerItem as parent. The created item will be on a child of the parent item

Parameters:
parent   The CGroupManagerItem which will be parent item of the new item
caption   The caption of the item. This parameter will eb passes to
See also:
init()
Parameters:
modulename   The name of our module. This is used in addition to the CModuleInfo object because sometimes the moduleinfo is missing and we don't want to loose bookmarks.
module_info   The CModuleInfo object we use for the item. May be zero because a group doesn't have a CModuleInfo.
Type   The type of the created item. May ba Module, Bookmark or Group. If you leave out the parameter it will be Module by default.

CGroupManagerItem::~CGroupManagerItem ( )

The destructor.

Cleans up memory.

Member Function Documentation

QString CGroupManagerItem::description ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the description of the item.

Returns:
The description of the item. Useful for bookmarks.

void CGroupManagerItem::init ( const QString & caption,
const QString & modulename,
CModuleInfo * module_info,
CKey * bookmarkKey,
CGroupManagerItem::itemType Type ) [private, virtual]

Initializes the item Used by both constructors to share the double used source code.

Parameters:
caption   The caption of the item
modulename   The modulename as a QSTring
module_info   The CModuleInfo object for this item. May be NULL because groups have no moduleinfo.
Type   The type of the item (Group, Bookmark or Module)

CSwordModuleInfo * CGroupManagerItem::moduleInfo ( ) [virtual]

Returns the CModuleInfo obkject for this tree-item.

Returns:
Gives back a pointer to the moduleinfo. May ba NULL because groups do not have moduleinfos.

CGroupManagerItem * CGroupManagerItem::parent ( ) [virtual]

Use this to get the parent item of the item-.

Returns:
The parent item. Maybe NULL if the item has no parent. Reimplementation.

void CGroupManagerItem::setOpen ( bool ) [virtual]

Show sub item if true, otherwise do not show them.

Reimplementation from QListViewItem

CGroupManagerItem::itemType CGroupManagerItem::type ( ) [virtual]

Use this function to get the type of this item.

Returns:
Returns the type of the item. May be Group, Bookmark or Module.

Member Data Documentation

QString CGroupManagerItem::m_caption [private]

The caption of the item.

Used for bookmarks and groups.

QString CGroupManagerItem::m_description [private]

The description of the item.

At the moment only useable for bookmarks.

CSwordModuleInfo * CGroupManagerItem::m_moduleInfo [private]

The pointer to the internal module_info At the moment we assume that the module of a CGroupmanagerItem is a CSwordModuleInfo object.

If we add new backend this should be changed.
